metadata.name: The Ghost Circus
metadata.description:
In 2007, a young boy named Lucas attended a circus with his father. Despite his fear of clowns, he was captivated by their playful antics, realizing that fear could transform into joy. As an adult and a father himself, Lucas cherished his childhood memories and created "The Ghost Circus," a work of art inspired by his son's love for circuses and clowns. It served as a reminder of the enduring spirit of childhood and the power of creating joyous moments with loved ones.


Luca's work of art became a symbol of resilience and transformation, reminding people that even in the face of fears and hardships, there is always a chance for happiness and healing. His creation touched the hearts of many, rekindling the magic of the circus in a world that sometimes forgets the importance of joy and wonder.

''The Ghost Circus'' - The first trauma.
